about_the_game:
This atmospheric psychological horror game follows Malka Spitzer, an artistic young woman from 1920s New York City who struggles with maladaptive daydreaming, as she confronts the demons of her mind. Trapped in a never-ending cycle of nightmares, Malka must descend through the levels of a mysterious building, facing her fears and uncovering the truth about her complexes. With the guidance of Joel, her charismatic childhood friend, Malka must navigate a mental landscape filled with dark secrets, twisted illusions, and terrifying monsters. Will she find a way to break free from the shackles of her own mind or be consumed by the darkness her mind has conjured?

Note: This game is a work of fiction. Any resemblance to real people, events, and locations is purely coincidental.

Note 2: I wouldn't have been able to finish this game without the help of my friends and the RPG Paper Maker community. Shoutout to Tete Depunk (@tete.depunk on IG), R.N. Roveleh (@helevorn_bor on IG), and The Digital Container (@cid331 on IG and Twitter) for all of your help. Check out my website to see the full list of credits, including music credits. The music for the trailer is Alexander Nakarada's royalty-free "Moon."

content_descriptors.notes: There are several implied references to sexual activity, but nothing is shown.

detailed_description:
This atmospheric psychological horror game follows Malka Spitzer, an artistic young woman from 1920s New York City who struggles with maladaptive daydreaming, as she confronts the demons of her mind. Trapped in a never-ending cycle of nightmares, Malka must descend through the levels of a mysterious building, facing her fears and uncovering the truth about her complexes. With the guidance of Joel, her charismatic childhood friend, Malka must navigate a mental landscape filled with dark secrets, twisted illusions, and terrifying monsters. Will she find a way to break free from the shackles of her own mind or be consumed by the darkness her mind has conjured?

Note: This game is a work of fiction. Any resemblance to real people, events, and locations is purely coincidental.

Note 2: I wouldn't have been able to finish this game without the help of my friends and the RPG Paper Maker community. Shoutout to Tete Depunk (@tete.depunk on IG), R.N. Roveleh (@helevorn_bor on IG), and The Digital Container (@cid331 on IG and Twitter) for all of your help. Check out my website to see the full list of credits, including music credits. The music for the trailer is Alexander Nakarada's royalty-free "Moon."
legal_notice: This is a free-to-play game made with the non-commercial version of RPG Paper Maker. The story and all of the characters in this game except for Tamara (who is my collaborator Tete Depunk's character) are copyrighted by Fortunus Games. Check out my website for detailed copyright information.

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 10.12/10.13/10.14
  • Graphics: OpenGL 3.3+ core profile
  • Storage: 650 MB available space

movies.name: The Projection Room of Malka Spitzer

name: The Projection Room of Malka Spitzer

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 7/8/10
  • Memory: 512 MB RAM
  • Storage: 600 MB available space

short_description: The Projection Room of Malka Spitzer is an atmospheric, psychological RPG adventure that delves into the depths of the mind. Unravel the enigmatic maze of dreams, confront inner demons, and challenge your perception of reality.
